title: Tests fail because of outdated Python version specified in test.yml
body:
``Error: Version 3.6 with arch x64 not found``

https://github.com/numixproject/numix-core/blob/d4b1230e3ae6713d1acdf534de26ebc960f82d07/.github/workflows/test.yml#L49 has python version hardcoded to ``3.6`` which is not provided anymore by GitHub actions according to here https://raw.githubusercontent.com/actions/python-versions/main/versions-manifest.json.

Cf. https://docs.github.com/en/actions/automating-builds-and-tests/building-and-testing-python
https://github.com/marketplace/actions/setup-python
https://github.com/actions/setup-python

title: whatsapp-nativefier no icon
body:
<!--
    This bug report is just for issues with the icon files (e.g. we've accidentally pushed an
    invalid SVG file like we did here: https//github.com/numixproject/numix-icon-theme/issues/1405).
    For icon requests and enhancements please use their respective issue templates.

    Please file issues with packaging in the theme's respective repo:

      - numix-icon-theme (base): https://github.com/numixproject/numix-icon-theme
      - numix-icon-theme-circle: https://github.com/numixproject/numix-icon-theme-circle
      - numix-icon-theme-square: https://github.com/numixproject/numix-icon-theme-square

    For issues with core use the Core Bug Report issue template.
-->

## Info
<!-- Give the operating system / Linux distro on which you're experiencing the problem. -->
Platform: Arch Linux rolling
<!-- If the bug relates to some specific external software, specify it and its version here -->
Related Software: [whatsapp-nativefier](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/whatsapp-nativefier)

## Affected Icons
<!-- List the icons which are affected by this bug. -->
- [ ] whatsapp

## Problem
<!-- Give a brief description of the problem you're having. -->
The `whatsapp` icon is not linked to `whatsapp-nativefier`, the icon name that appears in the [.desktop file](https://aur.archlinux.org/cgit/aur.git/tree/whatsapp-nativefier.desktop?h=whatsapp-nativefier)

## To Reproduce
<!-- If applicable, let us know what steps we should take to reproduce the error. -->

1. Install `whatsapp-nativefier` on Arch Linux
2. Install any numix icon theme
3. Look at tray icon for `whatsapp-nativefier`

## Screenshots
<!-- If applicable attach any screenshots demonstrating the problem. -->

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55339220/202647822-07058b10-9820-4498-94cb-b03ae07d738c.png)

title: Change cs-login.svg to link to login.svg to avoid wrong/duplicate icon
body:
The current cs-login.svg is a symlink to session-properties.svg.

There are two problems with this:

1. cs-login.svg is used by the System Settings control panel in Cinnamon for "Login Window". Clicking on "Login Window" launches lightdm-settings, which uses the login.svg icon, so there is currently an inconsistency.
2. session-properties.svg is also used by "Startup Applications" in the System Settings control panel in Cinnamon, so there are duplicate icons for different functions.

Please amend cs-login.svg in the /usr/share/icons/Numix-{Circle/Square}/48/apps/ folder so that it links to login.svg.

Thank you.

title: Automated Travis build stopped working
body:
According to
https://travis-ci.org/github/numixproject/numix-core
migration to travis-ci.com is needed.

title: Is display.svg supposed to be an app icon?
body:
We have got ``display`` included in our app themes by means of a symlink to ``preferences-desktop-display``.

This icon pops up in the screenshot tool of GNOME 3.38 in a place it shouldn't, it is supposed to be a device icon.

Is there a sound reason to keep it in the app icon themes?

title: Wrong OpenERP symlink
body:
We've got a symlink ``openerp-client`` to the root ``opera``.
Does this make a sense I fail to see?

title: Inconsistent Settings Icon In System Menu
body:
I find the Settings icon that appears in the Gnome system menu a bit inconsistent. It's next to the *Lock* and *Power* icons which are simply white monochrome icons, while the Settings icon is colored:

![colored-settings-icon](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76639/65796341-043c6180-e175-11e9-9d22-5574c5a3a82f.png)

Is this by design, is it something that you guys are willing to change or is it a misconfiguration on my side?

I'm running Gnome 3.34 on Arch Linux and I use the *Numix Circle Light* icon theme.

title: Ordered DB Test Crash
body:
I'm currently doing a refresh of some of the Python code and found that the [ordered_db.py](https://github.com/numixproject/numix-core/blob/63e2b9b4e3e5c94760800068c673c41dd3e58c67/tests/ordered_db.py) check breaks if the Android icons are out of order. This is because our current build script uses a structure with `/` characters in Android entries while the JSON loader seems to expect `,` characters for delimiters. The full crash is below.

```python3
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "ordered_db_old.py", line 23, in <module>
    data = json.load(db_obj, object_pairs_hook=OrderedDict)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/json/__init__.py", line 299, in load
    parse_constant=parse_constant, object_pairs_hook=object_pairs_hook, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/json/__init__.py", line 367, in loads
    return cls(**kw).decode(s)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/json/decoder.py", line 339, in decode
    obj, end = self.raw_decode(s, idx=_w(s, 0).end())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/json/decoder.py", line 355, in raw_decode
    obj, end = self.scan_once(s, idx)
json.decoder.JSONDecodeError: Expecting ',' delimiter: line 5769 column 13 (char 123776)
```

While the current work I'm doing on the tests does change this script it leaves this particular bug unfixed.

title: fcitx icons all lost in indicator tray
body:
I am using numix-circle as my icon theme. The fcitx icon in the system menu tray all lost. They all becomes the default keyboard. If I am using numix as my icon theme, the icons are there.

Original issue: [https://github.com/numixproject/numix-icon-theme-circle/issues/50](url)

Screen shot for Numix-Circle
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3879058/25548847/8576ca2e-2c3c-11e7-98af-47cdd50218ea.png)

Screen shot for Numix
![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3879058/25548927/ea8c7c1a-2c3c-11e7-873d-6a62ec511b23.png)

In the theme Numix-Circle it tries to using icon ![fcitx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3879058/25556642/fc081738-2ccd-11e7-87c1-fdb3cf216809.png) to replace icon ![fcitx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3879058/25556640/f56d2e2c-2ccd-11e7-89c3-5cce481208e8.png)

However, I found that all icons with prefix `"fcitx"` such as (fcitx-pinyin ![fcitx-sunpinyin](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3879058/25556671/658d5f7e-2cce-11e7-9e3c-e70a74d0f2e3.png) , fcitx-anthy ![fcitx-anthy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3879058/25556687/be989d68-2cce-11e7-91b5-e19381904d28.png) ) are replaced by the icon `"fcitx"`![fcitx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3879058/25556642/fc081738-2ccd-11e7-87c1-fdb3cf216809.png) under folder `"/usr/share/icons/Numix-Circle/48/apps/fcitx.svg"` which is a symbolic link to `"/usr/share/icons/Numix-Circle/48/apps/fcitx.svg"` . I tried to renamed `fcitix.svg` to some other name like `fcitix.svg.bak` and rebuild the icon cache. In that case, icons with prefix `fcitx` are found.

I read the index.theme of Numix-CIrcle. It sets the icon with size 48 having context `Application` and type `Scaleable` from 8 to 512. Is this setting too aggresive which cause the issue?

title: Problems with librsvg 2.41
body: User reported in numixproject/numix-icon-theme-circle#34 that our linear gradients aren't showing up properly, completely breaking the icon theme. Has anyone been able to replicate this?

title: Invalid use of "exit" function causes package compilation problems
body:
Hey,
I am ArchLinux user and i wanted to pack this package: https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/numix-icon-theme-pack/
At the end of the "gen.py" script you using "exit" function with string parameter which returns 1 (error code).

Please change to "print" function.

Regards,
Mateusz.

title: Numix Calendar issue
body:
There's a small issue in the Numix Calendar script, the issue is due to this line https://github.com/numixproject/numix-core/blob/master/data.json#L2016
On Numix Calendar we symlink the current day icon to https://github.com/numixproject/numix-calendar-icons/blob/master/calendar-script#L23 `office-calendar` which is already a symlink to the current day (31 of the month) we should replace the root to `office-calendar` and have the rest of the icons linked to it.

title: Issues with installing into ~/.local/share/icons
body:
I am trying to install numix-icon-theme-circle locally, and most things work fine except for some status bar icons (specifically InSync and fcitx). They are displayed as a question mark icon.

I have tried the following:
- Cloned the numix-icon-theme and numix-icon-theme-circle repositories and then moved all Numix\* directories into ~/.local/share/icons.
- Installed the packages from ppa and then copied the Numix\* directories from /usr/share/icons into ~/.local/share/icons, then uninstalled the packages.

Neither of these attempts were successful at fixing the status bar issue. Interestingly, cloning the repositories and copying the Numix\* directories into /usr/share/icons did work properly.

I am not sure what is causing this, but it seems like there is something that requires the install to be in /usr/share/icons.

Edit: I am running Ubuntu 15.10, in case it matters.
[This](http://imgur.com/a/LUkCD) is the difference I'm experiencing.

title: Problem with Bluetooth icon in top panel in Gnome Classic on Ubuntu
body:
Hi.

First of all, I would like to thank you for providing great icons! I really like them and they're much better and cleaner than default system icons.

Right now, I have small problem with Bluetooth icon in top panel. It is cut and inconsistent with the rest of icons what doesn't look nice on my system. I understand your intentions and I see that icon is changing when we're turning Bluetooth on and off, but can we indicate this change in a different way, to keep consistent monochromatic style in top panel? E.g. we can have two different types of monochromatic Bluetooth icons. I have turned this icon off in control panel, because it destabilized my _feng shui_, but I would like to have it back in consistent style. :-)

My problem is visualized below.

![bluetooth-icon-in-top-panel](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/695319/10478799/56d045a2-7260-11e5-91e3-eb780ad557a4.png)

I've found out that icons I want to use are located in:

```
/usr/share/icons/Numix/scalable/status/bluetooth-active-symbolic.svg
/usr/share/icons/Numix/scalable/status/bluetooth-disabled-symbolic.svg
```

and they look OK and consistent with the rest of the top panel icons

How can I bring them back to the top panel?
Kind Regards,
Piotr

title: InSync icon syncing status
body:
Hi,

The Numix Circle InSync icon is great - just wondered if we could show the syncing status as with the original icon?

When syncing it shows this (see top right) - blue sync icon:
http://www.webupd8.org/2013/03/unofficial-google-drive-client-insync.html

When finished syncing it shows this - a green tick:
https://www.liberiangeek.net/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/insync_precise_thumb.png

On error, it has a red cross - (sorry this is Mac not Ubuntu, but couldn't find a screenshot for that!):

title: Update fedy-based installation instructions
body:
The README says `sudo fedy -e numix_themes` should install the themes, but the latest version of fedy just opens, and does not install anything. There's an error in the console: `(gjs:4671): GLib-GIO-CRITICAL **: This application can not open files.` which might be the real cause, or simply the fact that fedy does not show the numix packages anymore in the latest version.

The fedy-based installation instructions should either be removed or updated.

title: Viber Indicator icon
body:
As you might be aware there is a nice viber-wrapper indicator as mentioned here:
http://www.webupd8.org/2014/11/viber-wrapper-indicator-hides-floating.html

It seems it simply uses the viber app icon so I've simply changed the colors in the existing Numix-Circle icon to monochrome and copied it to the sub-folder for size 22x22 to get a matching monochrome icon in my systray.

Maybe this can be in included in the official set as well?

title: KDE breakage
body:
Despite having done a few KDE icons lately I have never actually used KDE as my DE.

Yesterday I tried Numix Circle on _Kubuntu 15.04_ and _Fedora 21 KDE_ live isos and in addition to a few missing icons in the base theme a lot of Numix Circle icons appear broken all over the place (Menu, Dolphin, Gwenview, Muon Discover...).

It's not the breakage encountered on Github or in web browsers but looks like this:
![breakage](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7050624/7252079/bc7cfe86-e831-11e4-94b7-28e66aea420b.png)

So the issue is about paths exceeding the baseplate, recoloured objects showing the colour set previously and recoloured baseplates being transparent. The latter two might be somehow related two our dreaded Inkscape gradient bug.

It looks the same with other Qt-based viewers (like Nomacs).
The issue is due to KDE/Qt using a different SVG rendering backend system (Qt SVG instead of librsvg).

[According to this](https://forum.kde.org/viewtopic.php?f=19&t=121637) the KDE bugtrackers are full of related reports but the problem is with Qt and not likely to be fixed anytime soon.

Some more reports of Qt's mediocre SVG support:
http://www.qtcentre.org/threads/57772-How-to-replace-Qt-svg-render-engine
https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-12588
https://bugs.kde.org/show_bug.cgi?id=333497
https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-1865
https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-28636
http://matplotlib.1069221.n5.nabble.com/Qt-SVG-clipping-bug-it-s-NOT-a-matplotlib-bug-Qt-won-t-fix-td37980.html

Not sure if anything can/should be done on the Numix side, just writing this so as to anticipate similar bug reports.

title: Several (app) status icons are missing in size 24x24
body:
Hi, I am filing this report against Numix-Circle and not against Numix base because of https://github.com/numixproject/numix-icon-theme/issues/190

Now that Xubuntu has a panel canvas size of 24x24 (and e.g. 24x24 is also the wingpanel canvas size in elementary OS Freya, currently in Beta 2), several of the Numix status icons look too big and a little blurred because they only come in size 22x22 and not in 24x24. If they are missing in 24x24 but are present in 22x22, the 22x22 icons have to get scaled to 24x24, and that causes a bit of "friction".

In contrast, the panel canvas size in Ubuntu is 22x22, so all looks fine on Ubuntu.

Examplary comparative screenshot of the panel in Ubuntu 14.10 ("bare metal") above and Xubuntu 14.10 (VM) below (affected status icons pointed to):

![xubuntu1410_canvas_24x24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/6368524/d7bca626-bcdd-11e4-89a3-f55963664e62.png)

In this screenshot, the affected status icons are Shutter, Redshift, SysPeek and Y PPA Manager.

In Numix-Circle, there is a directory `22x22/status`, but not yet a directory `24x24/status`. So basically, the status icons in `22x22/status` would have to be added to `24x24/status`. Some of these icons in size 24x24 are already present in Numix base and just would have to be copied over to Numix-Circle, others are not.

This should be manageable by taking Numix-Circle's `22x22/status` directory as a guideline, so I filed this collective report. Please let me know if I should file a specific bug report for every specific status icon.

Segmentation fault (core dumped)

title: Psensor status icons
body:
Hi, in Ubuntu, the Psensor status icons in Numix-Circle are in need of correction (Ubuntu 14.04 LTS with Psensor 1.0.2).

Psensor has an application icon in Numix-Circle, psensor.svg. This icon is showing correctly in the Ubuntu Dash and Launcher.
![screenshot0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3236026/12d6f846-f0d9-11e3-8c05-70cf6d858f6d.png)

At the same time, Psensor comes with two status icons, psensor_normal.svg and psensor_hot.svg.
![screenshot1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3236032/1975b6ce-f0d9-11e3-8ee7-3efb7fc76759.png)
![screenshot2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3236035/1e8f0d86-f0d9-11e3-9012-556ea415541c.png)

At present, there is one Psensor status icon in Numix-Circle, called psensor.svg.
![screenshot3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3236046/5d3216dc-f0d9-11e3-876e-8b249ad9a861.png)

This status icon does not show in the Ubuntu menu bar, but rather the original status icon which is in hicolor.
![screenshot4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3236053/79ec2970-f0d9-11e3-8d85-ac6601accb4a.png)

After adding this icon as psensor_normal.svg to Numix-Circle, the correct Numix-Circle status icon is displayed.
![screenshot5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3236066/a04c51b2-f0d9-11e3-8fa7-30b7675a29bd.png)

In conclusion, in Numix-Circle, the status icon psensor.svg needs to be renamed in psensor_normal.svg, and the second status icon psensor_hot.svg needs to be created.

title: dialog-question Icon is also already in Numix (base)
body:
Hi, seeing that you intend to discard the new symlink in Numix-Circle for dialog-warning.svg and instead keep the existing Numix (base) icon for dialog-warning.svg,
https://github.com/numixproject/numix-icon-theme-circle/issues/844
may I suggest that you do the same with the dialog-question.svg icon. That one also already exists in Numix (base), and I would think that the base icon theme is a good place for these "dialogue icons".

Here are screenshots for those two icons in Numix above and (new) Numix-Circle below:
![dialog-question-numix](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3141437/0aae5fd8-e97c-11e3-9eb0-7d9ab2880ab9.png)
![dialog-question-numix-circle](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3141438/1012bea6-e97c-11e3-9f96-5c45ba7d4b7d.png)

The dialog-question icon is shown e.g. when emptying the trash in Thunderbird, and as an additional argument it would be good to have a consistent dialogue icon style in Firefox (dialog-warning icon when e.g. clearing all history) and Thunderbird.

Currently, this looks like this (Numix-Circle):
![dialog-question_1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3141428/bb172acc-e97b-11e3-9dd7-9f98f66850d0.png)

Until just recently, it looked like this (Numix):
![dialog-question_2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3141429/cec2a420-e97b-11e3-9557-e4da1b4086e2.png)

title: dialog-warning Icon is confusing
body:
Hi, when I wanted to clear all history in Firefox, in the dialogue box the Numix-Circle icon for "errors, bugs and crashes" was displayed. I was aware of this icon in the context of apport:
![dialog-warning-numix-circle](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3141094/bd67652e-e964-11e3-918e-e5c4c3fa4ace.png)

Until the latest big Numix-Circle updates, this dialogue box looked like this:
![dialog-warning-numix](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3141097/c4b14480-e964-11e3-94bb-482c834063ec.png)

I figure that this is the dialog-warning.svg icon, which apparently is a new symlink in Numix-Circle. With this, the Numix-Circle icon now precedes the previous Numix exclamation mark.

Has this been done on purpose? To me, this is irritating, as this should be a warning sign for a possibly wanted action, not an error indication of some kind. The warning does not seem to fit into the kind of situations where this icon is used.
![dialog-warning](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7164227/3141099/cc86277a-e964-11e3-9926-4e3523eafcd7.png)

Thanks for taking this into consideration.

title: Shutter crashes on "edit" when Numix-Circle icon theme is used
body:
Hey guys, I am not sure if this is the proper place to report this somewhat peculiar issue, but here it is:

Shutter, feature-rich and useful screenshot application, crashes when I click on the "edit" button to edit a screenshot (Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Shutter 0.90.1 via USC).

The thing is: this crash only occurs when Numix-Circle or Numix icon theme is selected. Shutter does NOT crash this way with e.g. Ubuntu-Mono-Dark, Humanity, Gnome, Hicolor or even Oxygen icon themes selected, all fine with those.

Actually, when I just went through all the available icon themes on my machine, this Shutter crash behaviour also occured with one single other icon theme: HighContrast.

There already is a bug report for Shutter on this, and some of the comments specifically refer to Numix-Circle: https://bugs.launchpad.net/shutter/+bug/1285287. I just wanted to check whether you are aware of this phenomenon and whether this could relate to an issue on Numix-Circle's end.

title: fix: lpi-translate.svg
body:
Icon may not render correctly on a machine without CJK support.
Converted character (語) to an object.

If you want to keep the character (語) around for future reference then we could move it off canvas, but I haven't done that here.

title: fix: arronax.svg
body:
arronax.svg was causing nautilus to segfault due to the text field which
created the ^ in the logo. Converted this to an object.

title: Weird message when updating numix-icon-theme-circle package
body:
Hey, guys.

I've noticed this weird message every time Numix Circle is updated from PPA:

Unpacking numix-icon-theme-circle (0.2+201404230017~417~ubuntu14.04.1) over (0.2+201404212146~416~ubuntu14.04.1) ...
gtk-update-icon-cache-3.0: The generated cache was invalid.
WARNING: icon cache generation failed for /usr/share/icons/Numix-Circle
Setting up numix-icon-theme-circle (0.2+201404230017~417~ubuntu14.04.1) ...

Is anything wrong here? Do I have to worry about it? Am I supposed to do anything here? If so, please, let me know what to do.

Thanks, guys.

brunces

title: [SQUARE] missing some icons in Ubuntu 14.04
body:
These are the list of some missing application icons in Ubuntu 14.04, which are not symlinked. I did the list in this format `icon-already-in-square.svg -> missing-icon.svg`

```
terminal.svg -> utilities-terminal.svg
file-manager.svg -> system-file-manager.svg
clementine.svg -> application-x-clementine.svg
text-editor.svg -> accessories-text-editor.svg
calc.svg -> accessories-calculator.svg
disk-check.svg -> gnome-disks.svg
libreoffice-main.svg -> libreoffice-startcenter.svg
preferences-desktop-keyboard.svg -> input-keyboard.svg
gnome-remote-desktop.svg -> remmina.svg
gnome-screenshot.svg -> applets-screenshooter.svg
```

title: Icon name incorrect (warsow)
body: I had asked for an icon for warsow yesterday (issue#550). It was fixed today, but with incorrect icon name. The output of the .dekstop file is 'Name=Warsow ; Icon=warsow128x128.png', but in numix-circle icon theme folder (/usr/share/icons/Numix-Circle/48x48/applications/), the icon was named as 'warsaw'.

title: Fix software-center starting (package-upgrade?)
body:
Getting this when starting software-center while on numix-circle icon theme:

```
daboross:~$ software-center
2014-04-01 21:34:43,895 - softwarecenter.ui.gtk3.app - INFO - setting up proxy 'None'
2014-04-01 21:34:43,898 - softwarecenter.db.database - INFO - open() database: path=None use_axi=True use_agent=True
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/software-center", line 142, in <module>
    app = SoftwareCenterAppGtk3(datadir, xapian_base_path, options, args)
  File "/usr/share/software-center/softwarecenter/ui/gtk3/app.py", line 387, in __init__
    self.datadir)
  File "/usr/share/software-center/softwarecenter/ui/gtk3/panes/historypane.py", line 78, in __init__
    self._get_emblems(self.icons)
  File "/usr/share/software-center/softwarecenter/ui/gtk3/panes/historypane.py", line 192, in _get_emblems
    pb = icons.load_icon(emblem, self.ICON_SIZE, 0)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/gi/types.py", line 43, in function
    return info.invoke(*args, **kwargs)
gi._glib.GError: Icon 'package-upgrade' not present in theme
```

The software-center opens fine when using the default elementary os theme.

body:
See also https://github.com/numixproject/numix-icon-theme-circle/commit/9dd15a60e70169159fcf0684ba960a1096499efe

Edit: by "broke," I mean the 48-pixel icons for LibreOffice apps became the generic Numix-Shine question mark.

title: index.theme file calls the theme "Numix-Round"
body: As a result, the theme is being called "Numix-Round" in Xfce's settings.

title: 16, 22, 24, 64, and 128-pixel mimetype icons using the wrong icons
body:
This issue is pretty much about what the title says.

I noticed this while using VLC; the icons are incorrect for .mp4 files, at the very least.

(This _should_ be solved by symbolic-linking or copying those icons to all the folders, in particular 16/22/24 pixels.)
